questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the mononuclear complex that exhibits SMM behavior at zero dc field and has the highest effective energy barrier among known photo-responsive Ln-SMMs?
questions.answer: [DyIII(SCN)2(NO3)(depma)2(4-hpy)2] (1Dy)

questions.question: What structural transformation occurs in 1Dy upon UV light irradiation?
questions.answer: 1Dy undergoes a structural transformation to form a 1D coordination polymer [DyIII(SCN)2(NO3)(depma2)(4-hpy)2]n (2Dy) through a SC-SC manner.

questions.question: What is the effect of the photocycloaddition reaction on the SMM properties of 1Dy?
questions.answer: The photocycloaddition reaction leads to a reduction of the effective energy barrier by half and the narrowing of the butterfly-like hysteresis loop.

questions.question: How does the blocking temperature change for the diluted sample after the photo-induced switch?
questions.answer: The blocking temperature changes from 3.8 K for 1Dy@Y to 2.6 K for 2Dy@Y.

questions.question: What is the role of the NO3- anion in the structure of 1Dy?
questions.answer: The NO3- anion provides three oxygen atoms for hydrogen bonding in different directions and changes the local coordination environment of DyIII, influencing the magnetic anisotropy of the material.

questions.question: What is the yield of the photocycloaddition reaction from 1Dy to 2Dy?
questions.answer: The yield of the photocycloaddition reaction from 1Dy to 2Dy is over 90%.

questions.question: What happens to 2Dy when it is exposed to 280 nm light?
questions.answer: 2Dy can be partially converted back to 1Dy upon exposure to 280 nm light, although the transformation is not complete.

questions.question: What is the significance of the axial Dy-O bond lengths in determining the SMM behavior of 1Dy?
questions.answer: The shorter axial Dy-O bond lengths in 1Dy enhance the magnetic anisotropy, contributing to its SMM behavior at zero dc field.

questions.question: How does the structural rigidity and flexibility of 1Dy contribute to its photocycloaddition reaction?
questions.answer: The structural rigidity and flexibility of 1Dy, achieved by modulating weak intermolecular interactions such as hydrogen bonding, enable it to tolerate slight structural changes and undergo a SC-SC photocycloaddition reaction.

questions.question: What is the effect of diluting 1Dy in a diamagnetic lattice on its magnetic properties?
questions.answer: Diluting 1Dy in a diamagnetic lattice weakens the intermolecular magnetic coupling interactions and partially inhibits the QTM process, leading to observable hysteresis loops at temperatures below 4.0 K.

questions.question: How does the photocycloaddition reaction affect the photoluminescence (PL) profile of 1Dy?
questions.answer: The photocycloaddition reaction raises the energy of the 3T state of the ligand in 2Dy, leading to a different PL profile from 1Dy with new peaks and changes in peak intensities.

questions.question: Is the photocycloaddition reaction of 1Dy to form 2Dy reversible?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Does the structural transformation from 1Dy to 2Dy occur in a non-SC-SC manner?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is the effective energy barrier of 2Dy higher than that of 1Dy?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the presence of NO3- anion in 1Dy reduce its SMM behavior?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Can 2Dy be completely converted back to 1Dy by thermal annealing?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Is the blocking temperature of 2Dy@Y higher than that of 1Dy@Y?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the photocycloaddition reaction lead to an increase in the unit cell volume from 1Dy to 2Dy?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is the effective energy barrier of 1Dy the lowest among all light-responsive Ln-SMMs reported so far?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the structural transformation from 1Dy to 2Dy result in a decrease in the magnetic blocking temperature?
questions.answer: True
